A: 14. Was the prophecy of Isaiah concerning Jesus fulfilled? (a) Yes, it was (b) No, it wasn't
15. After the Apostles were filled with the Holy Spirit, did they receive the power to kill their enemies? (a) True (b) False
17. Is a born again someone who lives a Christ-like life, following all the principles and laws of Jesus Christ? (a) True (b) False
18. Jesus said, 'I am the way, the truth and the life, no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.' Where can you find this statement? (a) John 3:16 (b) Acts 4:12 (c) John 14:6
19. Which disciple of Jesus asked where He would be going and how they could know the way? (a) Judas Iscariot (b) Simon Peter (c) Thomas
20. According to the material, is Jesus the way to the Father? (a) True (b) False
21. Can we see God, the Father, except we believe in Jesus? (a) True (b) False
24. A good _____________ is one who looks after a flock of sheep and gives his life for the sheep. (a) Shepherd (b) Sheep (c) Military
25. Which of these is NOT a quality of a good shepherd? (a) Kindness (b) Protection (c) Fear
26. Who is a good shepherd? (a) Jesus (b) Thomas (c) Judas
27. "I am a good shepherd; a good shepherd giveth his life for the sheep." Who made this statement? (a) Aboki (b) Jesus (c) Soldier
28. The bread of life is __________ who came from God to this world. (a) Jesus (b) Manna (c) Loaf
29. When we eat the physical bread, we get hungry again, but when we have Jesus, the bread of life, we will be given spiritual satisfaction all the time. (a) True (b) False
C: 30. Explain the concept of Jesus as the 'Living Bread of Life' and its significance for spiritual sustenance.
31. Discuss the role and responsibilities of a shepherd in biblical context, and how it relates to Jesus.
32. Elaborate on the meaning of being 'born again' and its importance in Christian theology.
